intro: Cologania purpurea, commonly known as the purple cologania, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its striking purple to violet flowers, which bloom in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a rough, hairy texture. Cologania purpurea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
